questions.question: Which of the following can an AWS customer use to launch a new Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) cluster? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: An Amazon RDS cluster can be launched either through the AWS Management Console (a web-based interface) or programmatically using AWS CloudFormation templates. CloudFormation allows infrastructure to be defined as code, while the console allows manual creation. AWS Concierge and S3 are not used to create RDS resources.

questions.question: Which of the following Reserved Instance (RI) pricing models provides the highest average savings compared to On-Demand pricing?

options.text: One-year, No Upfront, Standard RI pricing.
One-year, All Upfront, Convertible RI pricing.
Three-year, All Upfront, Standard RI pricing.
Three-year, No Upfront, Convertible RI pricing.

questions.explanation: Three-year, All Upfront, Standard Reserved Instances provide the largest discount compared to On-Demand pricing because the customer commits for the longest term and pays everything in advance, reducing AWS risk and cost.

questions.question: Which of the following are features of Amazon CloudWatch Logs? (Select TWO)

options.text: Summaries by Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

questions.explanation: CloudWatch Logs supports real-time log monitoring and allows customers to configure how long logs are retained. These features make it useful for troubleshooting, auditing, and compliance.

questions.question: Which of the following is an AWS-managed compute service?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a fully managed compute service where AWS handles the servers, operating system, and scaling. EC2 requires customers to manage the instances, and Aurora is a database service, not compute.

questions.question: A company wants to reduce the physical compute footprint that developers use to run code. Which service would meet that need by enabling serverless architectures?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda enables serverless computing, where developers run code without provisioning or managing servers, greatly reducing the physical compute footprint.

questions.question: Which of the following is the customer’s responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for patching the operating systems and software running on their Amazon EC2 instances. AWS manages the underlying physical infrastructure and networking.

questions.question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model who is responsible for configuration management?

options.text: It is solely the responsibility of the customer.
It is solely the responsibility of AWS.
It is shared between AWS and the customer.
It is not part of the AWS shared responsibility model.

questions.explanation: Configuration management is a shared responsibility. AWS configures and maintains the infrastructure, while customers configure their applications, operating systems, and security settings.

questions.question: Which security service automatically recognizes and classifies sensitive data or intellectual property on AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie automatically discovers, classifies, and protects sensitive data such as PII stored in Amazon S3.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describe the AWS pricing model? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS uses a pay-as-you-go pricing model and charges are variable, meaning customers only pay for what they use rather than committing to fixed long-term contracts.

questions.question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the AWS customer? (Select TWO)

options.text: Ensuring that application data is encrypted at rest.
Ensuring that AWS NTP servers are set to the correct time.
Ensuring that users have received security training in the use of AWS services.
Ensuring that access to data centers is restricted.
Ensuring that hardware is disposed of properly.

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting their data and training their users. AWS is responsible for physical data center security and hardware disposal.

questions.question: A customer is using multiple AWS accounts with separate billing. How can the customer take advantage of volume discounts with minimal impact to the AWS resources?

options.text: Create one global AWS account and move all AWS resources to that account.
Sign up for three years of Reserved Instance pricing up front.
Use the consolidated billing feature from AWS Organizations.
Sign up for the AWS Enterprise support plan to get volume discounts.

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations with consolidated billing allows multiple accounts to share volume discounts, Reserved Instances, and Savings Plans without moving resources.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 pricing model offers the MOST significant discount when compared to OnDemand Instances?

options.text: A Partial Upfront Reserved Instances for a 1-year term.
All Upfront Reserved instances for a 1 year form.
All Upfront Reserved Instances for a 3 year term.
No Upfront Reserved Instances for a 3 year term.

questions.explanation: A 3-year All Upfront Reserved Instance provides the highest discount because it represents the longest and most financially committed usage.

questions.question: Which AWS services should be used for read/write of constantly changing data? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS and Amazon EFS are designed for frequently accessed and constantly changing data. Glacier and Snowball are for archival or data transfer, and Redshift is for analytics.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows users to identify the changes made to a resource over time?
questions.explanation: AWS Config tracks configuration changes of AWS resources over time, enabling auditing and compliance monitoring.

questions.question: According to best practices, how should an application be designed to run in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: Loosely coupled components allow applications to be more resilient, scalable, and easier to maintain because failures in one component do not impact others.

questions.question: Which benefits are included with the AWS Business Support plan? (Select TWO)

options.text: 24/7 assistance by way of live chat or a telephone call.
Support from a dedicated AWS Technical Account Manager.
An unlimited number of cases and contacts.
15-minute response time for production system interruption cases.
Annual operational reviews with AWS Solutions Architects.

questions.explanation: The Business Support plan provides 24/7 access to AWS support and allows unlimited support cases and contacts.

questions.question: Which of the following is an AWS managed Domain Name System (DNS) web service?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is AWS’s managed DNS service used to route users to applications and resources.

questions.question: A user must meet compliance and software licensing requirements that state a workload must be hosted on a physical server. When Amazon EC2 instance pricing option will meet these requirements?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Hosts provide physical servers dedicated to a single customer, meeting licensing and compliance requirements that require physical isolation.

questions.question: Which of the Reserved Instance (RI) pricing models can change the attributes of the RI as long as the exchange results in the creation of RIs of equal or greater value?
questions.explanation: Convertible Reserved Instances allow customers to change instance attributes (such as type or family) as long as the new reservation is equal or greater in value.

questions.question: Which service is best for storing common database query results, which helps to alleviate database access load?
questions.explanation: Amazon ElastiCache stores frequently accessed data in memory, reducing the load on primary databases and improving performance.

questions.question: When should a company consider using Amazon EC2 Spot Instances? (Select TWO)

options.text: For applications that cannot have interruptions.

questions.explanation: Spot Instances are ideal for fault-tolerant and non-production workloads because they are low cost but can be interrupted by AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS tools assist with estimating costs? (Select three)

options.text: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator.

questions.explanation: Cost allocation tags help track spending, while the AWS Simple Monthly Calculator and the TCO Calculator help estimate AWS costs.

questions.question: A company wants to focus on business activities instead of managing compute and capacity. Which AWS service can be used to automatically add or remove Amazon EC2 instances based on demand?
questions.explanation: EC2 Auto Scaling automatically increases or decreases the number of EC2 instances based on demand.

questions.question: Which is the minimum AWS Support plan that includes Infrastructure Event Management without additional costs?
questions.explanation: The Enterprise support plan includes Infrastructure Event Management to help during large-scale operational events.

questions.question: Access keys in AWS Identity and Access Management (IM1) are used to:

options.text: Log in to the AWS Management Console.
Make programmatic calls to AWS from AWS APIs.
Log in to Amazon EC2 instances.

questions.explanation: IAM access keys are used for programmatic access to AWS services via APIs, SDKs, or the AWS CLI.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to query stored datasets directly from Amazon S3 using standard SQL?
questions.explanation: Amazon Athena allows users to run SQL queries directly against data stored in Amazon S3 without managing servers.

questions.question: How does AWS shorten the time to provision IT resources?

options.text: It supplies an online IT ticketing platform for resource requests.
It supports automatic code validation services.
It provides the ability to programmatically provision existing resources.
It automates the resource request process from a company’s IT vendor list.

questions.explanation: AWS allows programmatic provisioning through APIs, CloudFormation, and SDKs, drastically reducing provisioning time.

questions.question: Which AWS services can be used to gather information about AWS account activity? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: CloudTrail records API activity and CloudWatch monitors metrics and logs, together providing insight into account activity.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of Amazon S3? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is an object storage service that is highly durable and designed to store massive amounts of data reliably.

questions.question: A user wants guidance on possible savings when migrating from on-premises to AWS. Which tool is suitable for this scenario?

options.text: AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) Calculator.

questions.explanation: The AWS TCO Calculator compares on-premises infrastructure costs with AWS to estimate potential savings.

questions.question: Which of the following services is in the category of AWS serverless platform?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is the core AWS serverless computing platform.

questions.question: The use of what AWS feature or service allows companies to track and categorize spending on a detailed level?
questions.explanation: Cost allocation tags let companies categorize and track AWS spending at a detailed level.

questions.question: Which of the following inspects AWS environments to find opportunities that can save money for users and also improve system performance?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor analyzes your AWS environment to identify cost-saving, security, and performance improvements.

questions.question: Web servers running on Amazon EC2 access a legacy application running in a corporate data center. What term would describe this model?
questions.explanation: Using AWS with on-premises systems is known as a hybrid architecture.

questions.question: What technology enables compute capacity to adjust as loads change?
questions.explanation: Auto Scaling automatically adjusts compute capacity based on workload demand.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a managed NoSQL database?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is AWS’s fully managed NoSQL database service.

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct relationship between regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations?
questions.explanation: AWS Regions are geographical areas that contain multiple Availability Zones.

questions.question: What approach to transcoding a large number of individual video files adheres to AWS architecture principles?

options.text: Using a single large instance during off-peak hours.
Using a large GPU instance type.

questions.explanation: Using many instances in parallel follows cloud principles of scalability and distributed processing.

questions.question: Which AWS services can host a Microsoft SQL Server database? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Microsoft SQL Server can run either on EC2 (self-managed) or using Amazon RDS for SQL Server (managed).

questions.question: Which AWS IAM feature allows developers to access AWS services through the AWS CLI?
questions.explanation: IAM access keys are used by the AWS CLI and SDKs to authenticate API requests.

questions.question: The user is fully responsible for which action when running workloads on AWS?

options.text: Implementing controls to route application traffic.

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for configuring networking and routing of their application traffic.

questions.question: Which AWS support plan includes a dedicated Technical Account Manager?
questions.explanation: Only the Enterprise Support plan includes a dedicated Technical Account Manager.

questions.question: What time-savings advantage is offered with the use of Amazon Rekognition?

options.text: Amazon Rekognition provides automatic watermarking of images.
Amazon Rekognition provides automatic detection of objects appearing in pictures.
Amazon Recognition provides the ability to resize millions of images automatically.
Amazon Rekognition uses Amazon Mechanical Turk to allow humans to bid on object detection jobs.

questions.explanation: Amazon Rekognition automatically detects objects in images, saving time compared to manual tagging.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to automatically scale an application up and down without making capacity planning decisions?
questions.explanation: Amazon Auto Scaling automatically adjusts the number of resources without manual capacity planning.

questions.question: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) offers which of the following benefits over traditional database management?

options.text: AWS manages the data stored in Amazon RDS tables.
AWS manages the maintenance of the operating system.
AWS automatically scales up instance types on demand.

questions.explanation: Amazon RDS manages the underlying operating system, including patching and maintenance.

questions.question: A company’s web application currently has light dependencies on underlying components so when one component fails the entire web application fails. Applying which AWS Cloud design principle will address the current design issue?

options.text: Implementing elasticity enabling the application to scale up or scale down as demand changes.
Enabling several EC2 instances to run in parallel to achieve better performance.
Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components.
Doubling EC2 computing resources to increase system fault tolerance.

questions.explanation: Decoupling components increases fault tolerance so that failures in one component do not impact others.

questions.question: A customer would like to design and build a new workload on AWS Cloud but does not have the AWS-related software technical expertise in-house. Which of the following AWS programs can a customer take advantage of to achieve that outcome?
questions.explanation: AWS Partner Network Consulting Partners provide expertise to design and build AWS solutions.

questions.question: Which service stores objects, provides real-time access to those objects, and offers versioning and lifecycle capabilities?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 stores objects and provides features like versioning and lifecycle management.

questions.question: Distributing workloads across multiple Availability Zones supports which cloud architecture design principle?
questions.explanation: Distributing across multiple Availability Zones designs for failure by preventing a single point of failure.

questions.question: Which service should a customer use to consolidate and centrally manage multiple AWS accounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows multiple AWS accounts to be centrally managed and billed together.
